ground_truth: Tuvia throws out some wire across the track as a German motorbike comes into view. The brothers watch it plow into the wire and swarm towards the German soldier sprawled on the ground. They relieve the dead man of his weapon and rifle through his saddlebags. A car's headlights appear in the distance, and Zus and the others pick up the body, carry it to the side of the road, and toss it down into the wood. They take up their positions and watch the car draw nearer. The driver gets out of the open-topped car to investigate the obstacle in the road, peers to the side of the road near where Zus and the others are hiding. The two Germans in the car and their female companion light up. The driver opens his fly and takes a leak all over Zus, who tries to protect his face with his hands. The driver spots him, and Zus stabs him. The other Germans are ambushed from behind as the sergeant shoots blindly into the darkness. Asael and others chase after a private while Zus unleashes machine gun fire. Asael chases after the fleeing private and brings him down. Zus finishes up the Germans in the car as Asael shoots his prey point blank. The group examines the weapons they have collected, but more headlights appear in the distance, shining their beams straight at them. The brothers line up and open fire into the dazzling light. Peretz is hit, and Asael recoups more guns and runs into a field while Tuvia helps Peretz to his feet and pulls him away from the line of fire. He picks up another rifle and dashes into the bushes as an armored vehicle drives up. Soldiers jump off the back and run after Asael, who's haring across a field. Tuvia and Peretz stop by and watch the truck slowing down while a searchlight on its route picks out Asael running across the field. Armed Germans go after Asael, but their bullets whiz past him. The heavy searchlight is on the ground and picks out Tuvia, who fires straight at it, destroying the bulb. Asael is pursued like an animal, but he and Zus gather up their armory of guns and run. The next morning at their camp, sandy-haired Tuvia looks across at Zus with fury in his pale blue eyes. Laila is scraping the bottom of a cooking pot with a ladle. Shimon, in his hat, coat, and woolen scarf, watches her grimly, and others in the camp look pale and gaunt. Aron, chewing on a piece of bread, hands it to Rachel, the teenage girl, and she devours it. Tuvia turns to Malbin, who's sitting with Peretz, whose eyes are open but lifeless. Malbin shakes his head.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Tuvia discards some cable across the path as a German motorbike emerges into sight. The siblings observe it crash into the cable and crowd towards the German trooper sprawling on the soil. They divest the lifeless man of his firearm and rummage through his saddlebags. A vehicle's headlights emerge in the expanse, and Zus and the others lift up the corpse, carry it to the verge of the route, and hurl it down into the forest. They assume their stances and observe the vehicle approach closer. The operator exits the convertible to scrutinize the hindrance in the route, gazes to the verge of the route near where Zus and the others are concealing. The two Germans in the vehicle and their female associate ignite. The operator unzips his fly and urinates all over Zus, who attempts to shield his visage with his hands. The operator detects him, and Zus pierces him. The other Germans are trapped from behind as the sergeant discharges blindly into the obscurity. Asael and others pursue a private while Zus releases automatic weapon shots. Asael pursues the fleeing private and brings him down. Zus completes the Germans in the vehicle as Asael shoots his quarry point blank. The band inspects the firearms they have amassed, but more headlights emerge in the expanse, beaming their rays directly at them. The siblings brace and discharge into the blinding light. Peretz is struck, and Asael retrieves more guns and runs into a meadow while Tuvia aids Peretz to his feet and draws him away from the barrage. He picks up another firearm and sprints into the thickets as an armored carrier rolls up. Troopers leap off the back and chase Asael, who's speeding across a meadow. Tuvia and Peretz pause by and observe the carrier decelerating while a spotlight on its path highlights Asael sprinting across the meadow. Armed Germans pursue Asael, but their bullets whiz past him. The hefty spotlight is on the soil and highlights Tuvia, who shoots directly at it, shattering the filament. Asael is hunted like a creature, but he and Zus gather up their arsenal of firearms and escape. The subsequent dawn at their encampment, sandy-haired Tuvia looks across at Zus with rage in his pale azure eyes. Laila is scraping the bottom of a cooking vessel with a scoop. Shimon, in his headwear, coat, and woolen muffler, observes her grimly, and others in the encampment look pale and emaciated. Aron, chewing on a piece of loaf, hands it to Rachel, the adolescent girl, and she devours it. Tuvia turns to Malbin, who's sitting with Peretz, whose eyes are open but vacant. Malbin shakes his head.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Some wire was thrown out across the track by Tuvia as a German motorbike came into view. It is watched by the brothers as it plows into the wire, and they swarm towards the German soldier sprawled on the ground. The dead man is relieved of his weapon by them, and his saddlebags are rifled through. Headlights of a car appear in the distance, and the body is picked up by Zus and the others, carried to the side of the road, and tossed down into the wood. Their positions are taken up by them, and the car is watched as it draws nearer. The driver gets out of the open-topped car to investigate the obstacle in the road and peers to the side of the road near where Zus and the others are hiding. The two Germans in the car and their female companion light up. His fly is opened by the driver, and he takes a leak all over Zus, who tries to protect his face with his hands. Zus is spotted by the driver, and he is stabbed by Zus. The other Germans ambush them from behind as the sergeant blindly shoots into the darkness. A private is chased after by Asael and others, while machine gun fire is unleashed by Zus. Asael chases after the fleeing private and brings him down. The Germans in the car are finished up by Zus as Asael shoots his prey point blank. The weapons they have collected are examined by the group, but more headlights appear in the distance, and their beams shine straight at them. A line is formed by the brothers, and fire is opened into the dazzling light by them. Peretz is hit, and more guns are recouped by Asael, who runs into a field while Peretz is helped to his feet by Tuvia and pulled away from the line of fire. Another rifle is picked up by him, and he dashes into the bushes as an armored vehicle drives up. The back is jumped off by soldiers, and Asael, who's haring across a field, is run after by them. Tuvia and Peretz stop by and watch the truck slowing down while a searchlight on its route picks out Asael running across the field. Asael is gone after by armed Germans, but their bullets whiz past him. The heavy searchlight on the ground picks out Tuvia, who fires straight at it, destroying the bulb. Asael is pursued like an animal, but their armory of guns is gathered up by him and Zus, and they run. The next morning at their camp, sandy-haired Tuvia looks across at Zus with fury in his pale blue eyes. The bottom of a cooking pot is scraped by Laila with a ladle. Shimon, in his hat, coat, and woolen scarf, grimly watches her, and others in the camp look pale and gaunt. A piece of bread is chewed on by Aron, and it is handed to Rachel, the teenage girl, who devours it. Tuvia turns to Malbin, who's sitting with Peretz, whose eyes are open but lifeless. His head is shaken by Malbin.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Tuvia stretches wire across the track as a German motorbike approaches. The brothers swarm the fallen German soldier, seize his weapon, and check his saddlebags. When a car's headlights appear, they move the body aside and prepare. The driver exits the open-topped car, urinates on Zus, who stabs him. The Germans are ambushed as Asael chases and captures a fleeing private. They gather weapons, but more headlights approach. The brothers fire into the light, and Peretz is hit. Asael gathers guns and runs; Tuvia helps Peretz and escapes into the bushes as an armored vehicle arrives. Soldiers chase Asael, but their shots miss. Tuvia destroys a searchlight targeting Asael. The next morning at camp, Tuvia stares angrily at Zus. Laila scrapes a pot, Shimon observes grimly, and camp members look gaunt. Aron shares bread with Rachel. Tuvia turns to Malbin beside Peretz, who is unresponsive. Malbin shakes his head.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Tuvia throws wire across the track as a German motorbike appears. The brothers watch it hit the wire and rush to the fallen soldier, taking his weapon and searching his saddlebags. Car headlights appear, and they move the body into the woods. As the car approaches, the driver gets out, urinates on Zus, who retaliates by stabbing him. The Germans are ambushed, Asael chases and kills a fleeing private, and Zus finishes off the others. They examine the weapons but see more approaching headlights. They fire at the vehicle, and Peretz is hit. Asael gathers guns and runs, while Tuvia helps Peretz. An armored vehicle arrives; soldiers chase Asael, missing their shots. A searchlight exposes Tuvia, who destroys it. Asael escapes, and by morning, Tuvia glares at Zus, Laila scrapes a pot, and the camp appears gaunt. Aron shares bread with Rachel, and Tuvia looks at lifeless-eyed Peretz as Malbin shakes his head.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As a German motorbike emerges into view along the track, Tuvia deftly throws out some wire, setting a trap. The brothers watch intently as the motorbike unwittingly plows into the carefully placed wire, causing the German soldier to be thrown to the ground. Swiftly and with practiced efficiency, they swarm toward the sprawled, lifeless figure on the ground. With determined movements, they relieve the deceased soldier of his weapon and begin to rifle through his saddlebags for any useful items. As they are engaged in this task, the headlights of an approaching car become visible in the distance. In response, Zus and the others quickly pick up the soldier's body, carrying it to the side of the road where they unceremoniously toss it down into the woods. 

They then take up their strategic positions, their eyes keenly watching as the car draws nearer. The driver of the open-topped vehicle steps out to investigate the unexpected obstacle in the road. As he peers to the side of the road, he comes perilously close to where Zus and the others are hidden. Meanwhile, the two Germans seated in the car, along with their female companion, light up for a smoke. In a careless, brazen act, the driver opens his fly and begins to urinate all over Zus, who instinctively tries to protect his face with his hands. This act leads to the driver spotting him, and in a swift response, Zus stabs him decisively. 

The remaining Germans are taken by surprise as they face an ambush from behind, while the sergeant fires blindly into the enveloping darkness. Asael, along with others, chases after a fleeing private, and Zus unleashes a barrage of machine gun fire. Determined, Asael continues his pursuit of the private, ultimately bringing him down. Meanwhile, Zus efficiently finishes off the Germans who are in the car as Asael moves in to shoot his prey at point-blank range. 

The group examines the cache of weapons they have successfully collected, but their attention is quickly drawn back to the road as more headlights appear in the distance, their beams piercing the night and shining directly at them. The brothers, without hesitation, line up and open fire into the blinding, dazzling lights. Amidst this exchange, Peretz is hit, prompting Asael to quickly gather more guns and sprint into a nearby field while Tuvia aids Peretz to his feet, pulling him away from danger. Tuvia then grabs another rifle and makes a dash into the cover of the bushes just as an armored vehicle arrives. Soldiers leap from the back of the vehicle, pursuing Asael, who's sprinting across the open field with great speed. 

Tuvia and Peretz momentarily stop and observe the truck as it slows down, while a searchlight mounted on its route focuses on Asael, highlighting him as he runs across the field. Armed German soldiers give chase to Asael, but despite their efforts, their bullets zip harmlessly past him. The powerful searchlight, now illuminating the ground, picks out Tuvia, who, with precision, fires at it, successfully destroying the bulb and eliminating the threat. Asael is pursued relentlessly like an animal, but he manages to regroup with Zus, and together they swiftly gather their collection of weapons to make their escape. 

The following morning, back at their camp, Tuvia, with his sandy hair glinting in the early light, looks across at Zus, fury simmering in his pale blue eyes. Nearby, Laila is scraping the bottom of a cooking pot with a ladle, trying to make the most of the scant resources. Shimon, donned in his hat, coat, and woolen scarf, watches her with a grim expression, while others around the camp appear pale and gaunt from the harsh conditions. Aron, chewing on a modest piece of bread, hands it to Rachel, a teenage girl who eagerly devours it. Tuvia then turns his attention to Malbin, who sits with Peretz, staring blankly with lifeless eyes. In a silent exchange, Malbin shakes his head, conveying the gravity of their situation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As a German motorbike gradually comes into sight along the winding track, Tuvia skillfully throws out some wire, expertly setting a trap with precision. The brothers watch with intense focus as the motorbike unknowingly drives directly into the meticulously placed wire, resulting in the German soldier being violently thrown to the ground. Quickly and with practiced efficiency, they rush toward the prone, lifeless figure sprawled on the dirt. With determined and deliberate movements, they relieve the deceased soldier of his weapon and proceed to thoroughly search his saddlebags for anything of potential use. As they are absorbed in this task, the headlights of an oncoming car become visible in the distance. In response, Zus and the others hastily pick up the soldier's body, carrying it to the side of the road where they unceremoniously throw it down into the cover of the woods. 

They then assume their strategic positions, their eyes sharply focused and watching keenly as the car draws nearer. The driver of the open-topped vehicle steps out to investigate the unforeseen obstacle blocking the road. As he leans over to peer at the roadside, he unknowingly comes dangerously close to the spot where Zus and the others are hidden. Meanwhile, the two Germans seated in the car, along with their female companion, casually light up for a smoke, oblivious to the danger nearby. In a careless and brazen act, the driver opens his fly and begins to urinate carelessly all over Zus, who instinctively attempts to protect his face with his hands. This action results in the driver spotting him, and in a swift and decisive response, Zus stabs him with precision.

The remaining Germans are caught off guard as they are ambushed from behind, while the sergeant fires wildly into the surrounding darkness. Asael, alongside others, gives chase to a fleeing private, and Zus unleashes a relentless barrage of machine gun fire. Undeterred, Asael continues his pursuit of the private, ultimately bringing him down with determination. Meanwhile, Zus efficiently finishes off the Germans who remain in the car as Asael moves in closer to shoot his target at point-blank range. 

The group examines the cache of weapons they have successfully acquired, but their attention is quickly drawn back to the road as more headlights appear in the distance, their beams piercing through the night and shining directly at them. The brothers, without a moment's hesitation, line up and open fire into the blinding, dazzling lights. Amidst this exchange, Peretz is struck by a bullet, prompting Asael to swiftly gather more guns and sprint into a nearby field while Tuvia helps Peretz to his feet, pulling him away from the immediate danger. Tuvia then grabs another rifle and makes a dash into the cover of the bushes just as an armored vehicle arrives on the scene. Soldiers leap from the back of the vehicle and begin pursuing Asael, who is sprinting across the open field with great speed and determination.

Tuvia and Peretz pause briefly to survey the truck as it slowly approaches, while a searchlight mounted on its route zeroes in on Asael, highlighting him as he sprints across the field. Armed German soldiers give chase to Asael, but despite their best efforts, their bullets whiz harmlessly past him. The powerful searchlight, now illuminating the ground, picks out Tuvia, who, with calculated precision, fires at it, successfully destroying the bulb and eliminating the immediate threat. Asael is pursued relentlessly like prey, yet he manages to regroup with Zus, and together they quickly gather their collection of weapons to make their escape from the scene.

The following morning, back at their encampment, Tuvia, with his sandy hair catching the early morning light, looks across at Zus with fury simmering in his pale blue eyes. Nearby, Laila is diligently scraping the bottom of a cooking pot with a ladle, trying to make the most of their meager resources. Shimon, dressed in his hat, coat, and woolen scarf, watches her with a grim expression on his face, while others around the camp appear pale and gaunt from the harsh and unforgiving conditions. Aron, chewing on a modest piece of bread, hands it to Rachel, a teenage girl who eagerly devours it. Tuvia then turns his attention to Malbin, who sits quietly with Peretz, staring blankly with lifeless eyes. In a silent exchange, Malbin shakes his head, conveying the grave reality of their situation.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Tuvia skillfully throws out some wire across the track, anticipating the arrival of a German motorbike, which soon comes into view. The brothers, with a tense anticipation, watch as the bike inevitably plows into the wire. As the German soldier is thrown from the bike and sprawls on the ground, they swarm him with a sense of urgency. They quickly relieve the deceased man of his weapon and rifle through his saddlebags, searching for anything of use. Suddenly, the distant glow of a car's headlights appears, prompting Zus and the others to swiftly pick up the body. They carry it to the side of the road, exerting effort to move it swiftly and discreetly, before unceremoniously tossing it down into the woods. They waste no time in taking up their positions, crouching stealthily as they watch the car draw nearer. The driver of the open-topped car exits to inspect the obstacle on the road, his eyes scanning the area near where Zus and the others are hidden. Meanwhile, the two Germans in the car, accompanied by their female companion, casually light up cigarettes, oblivious to the imminent danger. The driver, feeling daring, unzips his fly and urinates, inadvertently showering Zus, who desperately tries to shield his face with his hands. The act, however, alerts the driver to Zus's presence, prompting Zus to react quickly by stabbing him. With precision, the others ambush the remaining Germans from behind, as the sergeant frantically shoots into the darkness, hoping to hit something, anything. Asael and his group give chase after a fleeing private, undeterred, while Zus discharges machine gun fire. Asael relentlessly pursues the private, ultimately bringing him down. With quiet efficiency, Zus finishes off the Germans in the car, while Asael shoots his captive at point-blank range. The group meticulously examines the weapons they have acquired, assessing their newfound arsenal, but their focus shifts abruptly as more headlights emerge from the distance, casting blinding beams directly toward them. Without hesitation, the brothers line up and open fire into the glaring light, knowing they have little time to waste. In the midst of this, Peretz is hit, prompting Asael to quickly gather additional guns and sprint into the nearby field, while Tuvia supports Peretz, helping him to his feet and pulling him away from the line of fire. Tuvia grabs another rifle and, with adrenaline coursing through his veins, dashes into the shelter of the bushes just as an armored vehicle approaches. As soldiers leap off the back of the vehicle, they pursue Asael, who is already tearing across the field. Tuvia and Peretz pause to observe the truck's slowing pace, its searchlight ominously illuminating Asael's path across the field. Despite the armed Germans' determined pursuit, their bullets merely whiz past Asael, failing to connect. The heavy searchlight, now set on the ground, picks out Tuvia, who responds with precision, firing directly at it and successfully destroying the bulb. Asael continues to be chased relentlessly like prey, but he and Zus manage to gather their cache of guns and make their escape at a run. The following morning, back at their camp, sandy-haired Tuvia directs a look filled with fury at Zus, the intensity of his pale blue eyes unmistakable. Laila is focused on scraping the bottom of a cooking pot with a ladle, trying to make do with what little they have. Nearby, Shimon, wrapped in a hat, coat, and woolen scarf, watches her somberly, the gravity of their situation evident. Others in the camp exhibit signs of hardship, their faces pale and gaunt. Aron, chewing on a piece of bread, wordlessly hands it to Rachel, a teenage girl who promptly devours it, illustrating the scarcity they face. Tuvia turns his attention to Malbin, sitting alongside Peretz, whose eyes are open yet hauntingly lifeless. With a somber shake of his head, Malbin silently conveys the gravity of their loss and the dire circumstances facing them all.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Tuvia sets a trap with wire across the track, causing a German motorbike to crash. The brothers quickly seize the fallen soldier's weapon and rummage through his saddlebags. As a car approaches, Zus and the others move the body aside and prepare for an ambush. When the driver exits the car to investigate, he's caught off guard and relieved of his life by Zus, who retaliates when discovered. The remaining Germans, distracted, are attacked from behind, with Zus and Asael taking decisive action against their targets. Asael captures a fleeing soldier, while Zus finishes the occupants of the car and reviews their loot. As more vehicles approach, the brothers engage in a firefight, with Peretz getting hit. Asael recoups weapons, and Tuvia helps Peretz retreat before evading an advancing armored vehicle. Tuvia destroys a searchlight targeting Asael, who narrowly escapes the pursuing Germans. The next morning at camp, tension is palpable as Tuvia glares at Zus. Laila scrapes a cooking pot, Shimon watches solemnly, and the camp's inhabitants appear weary and gaunt. Aron shares his bread with Rachel, who eagerly consumes it, while Tuvia receives a grim nod from Malbin beside the lifeless-eyed Peretz.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Tuvia throws out some wire across the track as a German motorbike, part of a Wehrmacht patrol known for its speed and mobility, comes into view. The brothers, who were partisans in the dense forests of Eastern Europe during World War II, watch it plow into the wire and swarm towards the German soldier sprawled on the ground. They relieve the dead man of his weapon, an MP40 submachine gun, and rifle through his saddlebags, likely finding maps or orders that could aid their resistance efforts. A car's headlights appear in the distance, and Zus and the others pick up the body, carry it to the side of the road, and toss it down into the wood, a common tactic to avoid detection. They take up their positions and watch the car, a staff car typically used by German officers, draw nearer. The driver gets out of the open-topped car to investigate the obstacle on the road, peers to the side of the road near where Zus and the others are hiding, knowing full well the danger of partisan attacks. The two Germans in the car and their female companion, likely a secretary or a civilian forced into service, light up. The driver opens his fly and takes a leak all over Zus, who tries to protect his face with his hands. The driver spots him, and Zus stabs him, using a knife often carried by resistance fighters for close combat. The other Germans are ambushed from behind as the sergeant shoots blindly into the darkness. Asael and others chase after a private, who is part of the invading forces, while Zus unleashes machine gun fire from a position of cover. Asael chases after the fleeing private and brings him down with a tackle learned from their survival training. Zus finishes up the Germans in the car as Asael shoots his prey point blank, a brutal necessity in their fight for survival. The group examines the weapons they have collected, including grenades and ammunition that are always in short supply, but more headlights appear in the distance, shining their beams straight at them. The brothers, knowing they are outnumbered, line up and open fire into the dazzling light. Peretz is hit, and Asael recoups more guns and runs into a field while Tuvia helps Peretz to his feet and pulls him away from the line of fire, mindful of the German reinforcements. He picks up another rifle, a weapon they desperately need, and dashes into the bushes as an armored vehicle, likely an Sd.Kfz. half-track, drives up. Soldiers jump off the back and run after Asael, who's haring across a field where their camp lies hidden. Tuvia and Peretz stop by and watch the truck slowing down while a searchlight, standard on German patrol vehicles, on its route picks out Asael running across the field. Armed Germans go after Asael, but their bullets whiz past him, unable to match his desperation-fueled speed. The heavy searchlight is on the ground and picks out Tuvia, who fires straight at it, destroying the bulb and plunging the area into darkness. Asael is pursued like an animal, but he and Zus gather up their armory of guns and run back to their forested refuge. The next morning at their camp, a hidden enclave known only to those fighting for freedom, sandy-haired Tuvia looks across at Zus with fury in his pale blue eyes, a sign of the stress and pressure they all face. Laila is scraping the bottom of a cooking pot with a ladle, trying to make the most of their limited provisions. Shimon, in his hat, coat, and woolen scarf, watches her grimly, as the chill of the early morning bites. Others in the camp look pale and gaunt, a direct consequence of the ongoing struggle to find enough food. Aron, chewing on a piece of bread scavenged from a recent raid, hands it to Rachel, the teenage girl who joined their band after her village was attacked, and she devours it, hungry from the constant rationing. Tuvia turns to Malbin, who's sitting with Peretz, whose eyes are open but lifeless, evidence of the toll war takes on the spirit. Malbin shakes his head, indicating that despite the night’s success, the losses weigh heavily on them all.

In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. Peretz is hit and Asael recoups more guns and runs into a field while Tuvia helps Peretz to his feet and pulls him away from the line of fire. Tuvia turns to Malbin who is sitting with Peretz whose eyes are open but lifeless. Malbin shakes his head.

The driver gets out of the opentopped car to investigate the obstacle in the road. peers to the side of the road near where Zus and the others are hiding. The two Germans in the car and their female companion light up. The driver opens his fly and takes a leak all over Zus who tries to protect his face with his hands. The driver spots him and Zus stabs him. The other Germans are ambushed from behind as the sergeant shoots blindly into the darkness. Asael and others chase after a private while Zus unleashes machine gun fire. Asael chases after the fleeing private and brings him down. Zus finishes up the Germans in the car as Asael shoots his prey point blank. The group examines the weapons they have collected but more headlights appear in the distance shining their beams straight at them. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. The brothers line up and open fire into the dazzling light. Peretz is hit and Asael recoups more guns and runs into a field while Tuvia helps Peretz to his feet and pulls him away from the line of fire. He picks up another rifle and dashes into the bushes as an armored vehicle drives up. Soldiers jump off the back and run after Asael who is haring across a field. Tuvia and Peretz stop by and watch the truck slowing down while a searchlight on its route picks out Asael running across the field. Armed Germans go after Asael but their bullets whiz past him. The heavy searchlight is on the ground and picks out Tuvia who fires straight at it destroying the bulb. Asael is pursued like an animal but he and Zus gather up their armory of guns and run. The next morning at their camp. sandyhaired Tuvia looks across at Zus with fury in his pale blue eyes. Laila is scraping the bottom of a cooking pot with a ladle. Shimon in his hat coat and woolen scarf watches her grimly and others in the camp look pale and gaunt. Aron chewing on a piece of bread hands it to Rachel the teenage girl and she devours it. Tuvia turns to Malbin who is sitting with Peretz whose eyes are open but lifeless. Malbin shakes his head.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Tuvia throws out some wire across the track as a German motorbike comes into view. The brothers watch it plow into the wire and swarm towards the German soldier sprawled on the ground. They relieve the dead man of his weapon and rifle through his saddlebags. A car's headlights appear in the distance and Zus and the others pick up the body carry it to the side of the road and toss it down into the wood. They take up their positions and watch the car draw nearer. The driver gets out of the opentopped car to investigate the obstacle in the road. peers to the side of the road near where Zus and the others are hiding. The two Germans in the car and their female companion light up. The next morning at their camp. sandyhaired Tuvia looks across at Zus with fury in his pale blue eyes. Laila is scraping the bottom of a cooking pot with a ladle. Shimon in his hat coat and woolen scarf watches her grimly and others in the camp look pale and gaunt. Aron chewing on a piece of bread hands it to Rachel the teenage girl and she devours it. Tuvia turns to Malbin who is sitting with Peretz whose eyes are open but lifeless. Malbin shakes his head.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Tuvia throws out some wire across the track as a German motorbike comes into view. The brothers watch it plow into the wire and swarm towards the German soldier sprawled on the ground. They relieve the dead man of his weapon and rifle through his saddlebags. Aron chewing on a piece of bread hands it to Rachel the teenage girl and she devours it. Tuvia turns to Malbin who is sitting with Peretz whose eyes are open but lifeless. Malbin shakes his head.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Claude tosses out some string along the path as a French bicycle rolls into sight. The kids observe it crash into the string and swarm towards the French courier sprawled on the lawn. They relieve the lifeless courier of his sandwich and rummage through his backpacks. A truck's taillights shine in the horizon, and Max and the others grab the statue, drag it to the corner of the alley, and drop it down into the ditch. They take up their spots and watch the truck move closer. The mechanic gets out of the covered-top truck to inspect the barrier in the alley, squints towards the edge of the alley near where Max and the others are lurking. The two Italians in the truck and their feline passenger laugh aloud. The mechanic opens his map and scribbles on Max, who attempts to shield his eyes with his arms. The mechanic notices him, and Max whispers to him. The other Italians are tricked from beneath as the chef shouts loudly into the dawn. Aaron and others sprint after a gardener while Max unleashes pebble tosses. Aaron sprints after the retreating gardener and pins him down. Max finishes off the Italians in the truck as Aaron clicks his target point-blank. The crew inspects the sandwiches they have gathered, but more taillights appear in the horizon, casting their glows straight at them. The kids line up and shout wildly into the glaring shine. Felix is startled, and Aaron recovers more sandwiches and sprints into a garden while Claude assists Felix to his feet and pulls him away from the shower of pebbles. He grabs another sandwich and dashes into the hedges as an armored scooter rides up. Workers jump off the deck and dash after Aaron, who's leaping across a garden. Claude and Felix pause by and observe the scooter slowing down while a flashlight on its path reveals Aaron sprinting across the garden. Armed Italians chase Aaron, but their shouts echo past him. The dim flashlight is on the terrain and highlights Claude, who hurls a rock at it, shattering the glass. Aaron is chased like a rabbit, but he and Max collect their supply of sandwiches and flee. The next afternoon at their shelter, curly-haired Claude glances across at Max with warmth in his dark brown eyes. Carla is stirring the top of a teapot with a spoon. Simon, in his cap, sweater, and leather belt, observes her happily, and others in the shelter look bright and healthy. Leo, nibbling on an apple, offers it to Sarah, the young girl, and she relishes it. Claude turns to Mason, who's sitting with Felix, whose eyes are open but vibrant. Mason nods his head.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Tuvia sets a trap on the track as a German motorbike approaches. The brothers attack, taking the soldier's weapon and searching his saddlebags. When a car arrives, they hide, but the driver urinates on Zus, prompting Zus to stab him. The remaining Germans are ambushed; Asael and Zus effectively tackle them, gathering their weapons. As car headlights approach, the brothers fire, but Peretz is hit, prompting Tuvia to help him flee. Asael is pursued but manages to escape with Zus. The next morning at camp, Tuvia is visibly angry while Laila cooks, Shimon and others appear grim, and Rachel accepts bread from Aron. Tuvia checks on Peretz, finding him lifeless.
